job_title: Operations Supervisor in Alpharetta, GA
pros: Delta Dental has afforded me an opportunity to be the change I want to see in the world. As someone who did not have an extensive background in insurance or dentistry or corporate America, there were not a ton of options for mainstream success as an african american male in the south. Delta, through great leaders who invested time in my development and provided me the opportunities to both fail and succeed, has helped me to see myself on a different level and the continued investment in our development and additional opportunity has allowed me to share my story with others and create opportunities for others to use their skills to continue advancing and transforming our organization. We are agile. We are adaptable. And We Care about the entire individual.
cons: Consistency and Visibility. Those are things that I think in any business are important. Delta has shown the ability to transform for the moment and is on the path of a culture transformation that will be beautiful but with that comes growing pains but we must remain consistent and bring visibility to the work being done on the front line.

job_title: Customer Advocate II in Alpharetta, GA

The only allows 25 seconds between calls and want you to average about 60 calls a day . I spent many nights working past my shift,with no pay, just to complete my service forms .

review_title: Creating smiles. Improving health.  Enhancing lives.
job_title: Executive Assistant in San Francisco, CA
pros:
I have worked for Delta Dental of California since the beginning of 2018. I am in an executive assistant role supporting a C level executive. Within my first year at Delta Dental, we moved offices (down the street) and the new office is warm, welcoming, with an efficient layout and collaborative workspace. In addition to our SF office, we have a sister office in Oakland that mimics the attributes of our SF office. Both offices are conveniently located near BART and buses for those who commute on public transportation. 
While Delta Dental recruits’ top talent on an ongoing basis, there are many employees who have been with the company for decades that have been promoted. 
Benefits are outstanding and the company is often providing employees company swag. During the pandemic employees have received mask, Starbucks cards, workout bands and a stipend to outfit their remote work set up. 
Management listens to employees and their feedback. Frequent Town Halls from the CEO, allow employees to stay up to date, get questions answered and provide feedback. 
Delta Dental has a strong presence in serving the community. Through donations from their foundation and employee engagement for volunteering and donating. 
Learning and Development is a focus, and the company provides an array of courses on wellness, leadership and navigating the challenges of a pandemic.
cons: Internal portal for approval process lacks efficiency and puts mundane administrative responsibilities on to the executives that could otherwise be handled by their assistants.

job_title: Software Engineer in Lansing, MI
pros: Its a good place to work
cons: Didnt face any cons actually.

review_title: One of the best employers in Atlanta!!!
job_title: Associate Customer Advocate in Alpharetta, GA
pros:
-Free Dental Insurance
-Ample Vacation & Time Off
-Quarterly Bonuses
-Employee Engagement
cons:
Please note, that these are not what I personally consider to be con's but perhaps for someone else that is not DRIVEN or SELF Motivated

-Starting pay (Starting pay is lower than other call centers that I've worked at, but you have the opportunity to increase your overall pay and total compensation by coming to work everyday, following your schedule, and giving a 110% to your job!)

-Not a remote job (You may start out doing remote training, but expect to come to work everyday in a socially distant beautiful state of the art office building!)

-Very fast pace working environment (Your day will fly by because its very fast paced!)

-Periodic Mandatory Overtime (When its super UBER busy, expect to have mandated overtime, but if everyone that was hired, came to work everyday, and stuck to their schedule, there would be no need for mandated OT. Look at the mandated OT as an opportunity to bulk up your paycheck, which is always nice!

-Can't think of any other CONS :)

review_title: Exactly an employer I always dreamt of
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Alpharetta, GA
pros:
1. Change is the only constant - The leadership team ensures to continuously listen to feedback and make changes based on the same.

2. Competitive compensation - The overall compensation including bonus(very competitive indeed) can easily match any big tech organizations and can surpass most of them. 

3. Learning and Growing - Growth in different dimensions is always the priority be in terms of adapting to cutting edge technologies or learning latest tech trends.

4. Serving the community - Serving the community is one of the biggest X factors of Delta Dental which makes it so different from other employers in the same domain. As employees we always get a lot of motivations and great platforms to help the community in different ways.

5. Improving work culture - The working culture is great and strives for excellence without forcing employees to be uncomfortable. It also ensures to manage work-life balance to the best of its abilities.
cons:
1. Work can be relaxing and no one pushes employees to outperform themselves. If you are someone who always needs a push to strive it may not be a great place 
for you.

2. Some HR policies related to vacation are outdated and needs some changes to be at par with the other organizations.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Rancho Cordova, CA
pros:
I am very excited to work for Delta Dental. The company culture has been amazing, and the contributions being made to serve, educate, and inspire the community is phenominal. As an employee I am thrilled to work with such a diverse, humble, passionate and personable group of professionals. Truly a great place to work and grow, while promoting kindness, and inspiring leadership through all that the company does for the community and its employees. Please keep up the amazing efforts, and continue to engage and serve the community. 

I am also very excited about Delta Debtal’s social network outreach efforts. The professionalism of staff is great, and most important they bring the human touch back into the workplace reminding us that we can all value from the experience of others both inside and outside the office. Life lessons and events are shared from collegues and staff which are meaningful, personal (professional) and this, to me shows great pride in company value, culture, and moral. 


Thank you.
cons: No Cons, inspiration is everywhere, you just have to be open to recievinc and acting on it. Great company to work for, I enjoy the work I do, and comming to work for this amazing company everyday.

job_title: Enrollment Clerk in Harrisburg, PA

job_title: D2C Customer Representative in Alpharetta, GA

cons: Calls can be overwhelming, there’s A high turnover rate, Dental is complex and the amount of information you need to know to accurately perform your job is A lot.

job_title: Account Services Coordinator in Rancho Cordova, CA

review_title: Toxic and Atrocious High School-like Work Environment.
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Alpharetta, GA
pros: What I really liked was the great pay along with the benefits.
cons:
Truth of the matter the company is not a career because there's no chance in career advancement and growth. The actual problem are management and upper level management who are the ones that undermine the business through lies, deception and favoritism. The co-workers and supervisors are bullies with a high school-like juvenile mindset as they get mad and complain about nothing, Whenever you ask for help, they love to get a sarcastic smart-alec attitude.

As far as customer service representative, its corporate slavery at its finest. Two weeks of training through useless book work material. After that I along the others were thrown to floor to get berated and degraded by members and providers who like to complain over nothing. Its really a stressful job which brings out stress, depression, anxiety and other mental issues. I had to resign from the company because my supervisor ordered me to return to the office infested with Covid-19.

Do not work in the corporate industry because you will be mistreated and disrespected. Do not apply for CSR-I because you are asking for trouble and will eventually regret it. You won't grow and advance there.

job_title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) II in Atlanta, GA

cons: CA hours, 12-9pm. Use your own laptop for remote work.

job_title: Director, Talent Development in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Delta Dental has been a fantastic place for me to work over the last few years. I've got supportive leadership, a talented team and peers, and a senior leadership team that invests company resources in my team's work. I've been impressed by the focus on innovation - one of our corporate values - and how it shows up in various ways. I appreciate that we're not resting on our laurels - we're actively evolving to maintain our position as the market leader.
cons: There are pockets of the organization that are slioed in their thinking and/or struggle with change. This is somewhat to be expected for an organization of Delta Dental's age and with our legacy of several organizations merging into a single enterprise, and our senior leaders are focused on changing this part of our culture.

review_title: Support for professional development, accommodating to staff with disabilities.
job_title: Communications in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Manager is invested in my professional development and growth. Also not a micro-manager.
Surrounded by people who are genuinely fun to be around but are also committed to producing quality work and being good collaborators.
Offered full support to get me what I needed to accommodate for my disability, management went out of their way to make me feel comfortable and valued.
Interactions with senior leadership have all been positive. They’re friendly and approachable, but even more importantly, they have a vision for Delta Dental.
San Francisco office is very modern and has a nice airy aesthetic.
Commitment to social good, as well as diversity and inclusion.

It was a really (really) difficult decision leaving my previous company of eight years, but I’m so so glad I did.
cons: No company is perfect. I will update my review when I come across major issues.

job_title: Contact Center Supervisor in Alpharetta, GA
pros:
Some of the Pros of working for Delta Dental are competitive pay, great benefits, and a great atmosphere to work. It really feels like a big family. We have theme days (pj day is always fun), in office and work from home games and competitions . We have a lot of volunteer opportunities ( great news is you get paid for 2 days of volunteering just like you were at work!) and often help within the community. We do food and clothing drives along with many other ways to give back to our community.
Also there is a great work life balance working at Delta Dental. We have weekends off except for a few during our heavier call time (open enrollment) but its volunteer only and it paid as overtime.
cons: As far as cons - you have to be ready for change. Our leaders try to give us as much advance notice as they can but sometimes change can happen quickly.

job_title: Customer Advocate II in Alpharetta, GA
pros: Great company to work for as everyone is supportive.
cons: They could have better technology and processing systems.

job_title: Total Rewards Director in Oakland, CA
pros: Leadership recognized the company needed to transform & focus on improving the employee experience. Three years into that transformation many significant positive changes have occurred. Technology is improving, benefits & retirement programs are fantastic and a new well-being program implemented, and quarterly pulse surveys of employees help managers understand our needs. Leadership throughout the COVID crisis have stepped up to help us get through the change it has brought about....while keeping the business running smoothly.
cons: There's still work to be done. Technology in some areas still requires improvement to make jobs easier. And not all managers truly understand how to be a leader. But the company is investing in tech, manager development and their employees and it is on the right path. Rome wasn't built in a day, and it takes time to change the culture of a large company.

They say that promote within but they are always short staffed so promoting within does not usually happen

job_title: Applications Development Manager in Alpharetta, GA
pros:
-employee empowerment: leadership believes in the employees, this encourages me to always bring my best everyday
-culture of learning: always looking for new ways to improve
-corporate core beliefs actually mean something here: alignment from what is said to actions taken
-flattened knowledge silos: development environment supports truly cross functional teams
-great health care benefits
-competitive salary with the rest of industry
cons: -needs broader social media footprint to attract new talent. I knew little about this company before applying for my current position and didn't realize what an excellent environment this is to work in.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Alpharetta, GA
pros:
Great benefits
Annual Bonuses
Usually great leadership
cons: You may be overlooked for opportunity a lot!

job_title: Claims Data Processor in Guaynabo, PR

review_title: Delta Dental is a fantastic place to work!
job_title: Professional Relations Representative in Rancho Cordova, CA
pros: Delta Dental is a great company to work for. I have worked for the company for 17 years and would not want to go anywhere else. Delta Dental allows for career advancement and invests in its employees with competitive pay, a great benefits package including great health coverage, tuition assistance and generous vacation. Delta Dental promotes employee health and wellness and strives for employees to have a work-life balance.
cons: Delta Dental grew so fast as a company that new technology implementation has been challenging in the past. Delta Dental has since brought in a new leadership team that is tech-savvy and will help Delta Dental remain relevant and at the forefront of a competitive marketplace.

job_title: Claims Examiner in Atlanta, GA
pros: health and dental benefits are amazing, yearly bonuses
cons: seems like employee concerns aren’t heard and always do what’s “ better for the company” vs listening to employee requests

job_title: Customer Service Representative II in Alpharetta, GA
pros: There is great job stability. Great people work for the organization. Bonus paid on how you perform.
cons: Very easy to get burned out at this job.

review_title: Delta is a great place to work
job_title: Appeals Representative in Rancho Cordova, CA
pros:
I joined Delta Dental in early 2019. When Covid hit and the world stopped as we knew it, we were taken care of very well by this company. I enjoy my work and really enjoy the people I work with and for.
I work in Grievance and Appeals and currently getting ready to launch new and innovative software for only G&A. I am thrilled to be included in this process and it is a very exciting time to work for Delta Dental.
cons: I don't think this is really a "con" but some people might, you have to be willing to work hard and take advice from Supervisors and Senior Leadership.

review_title: Focus on employees, focus on the community!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oakland, CA
pros: Generous benefits, $1000 matching donations, 16 hours of paid volunteer time off, culture of respect, work-life balance, and my birthday off! Also, many types of positions lend themselves to remote work, and when that happens, the organization supports it and offers many ways to collaborate from a distance.
cons: I'm not Pollyanna, but I can't think of any cons. I do think that some departments may have little room for upward mobility, but not everyone wants that.

review_title: Great Job but could be better.
job_title: Supervisor, Enterprise Operations in Alpharetta, GA
pros: Benefits are the only perk.
cons: Everything else is a con. We have worked through a pandemic and still as members of leadership been forced to put our families in danger and work in office.

job_title: Director Infrastructure Operations in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Long Tenured Employees, anti-Micromanagement and Multi-Location
cons: Have yet to fully embrace remote working

job_title: Customer Service Specialist II in Alpharetta, GA
pros:
Once you're a regular employee, the pay and benefits are nice.
Dental insurance of course, as well as various health plan options
Work environment isn't hostile
Raffles and activities
cons: All the systems are outdated, leadership is constantly away in meetings leaving no one to help agents who need it, training is very short, only leaves you with more questions, and results in incorrect transfers and angry callers. If you have no sick time but have a doctor's note, you STILL get penalized for it. Billing and claims have always been an issue, which only generates more back to back to back to back calls from angry/confused members.

job_title: Provider Onboarding Specialist in Cumming, GA
pros: Great Culture, fosters employee growth
cons: Few remote opportunities, but working on it

job_title: Correspondence Specialist in Sacramento, CA
pros:
Growth opportunities 
Fantastic Benefits 
Flexibility to work from home
cons: Out of date systems and processes

review_title: Best company I’ve ever worked for
job_title: Vice President in San Francisco, CA
pros: Delta Dental has gone through incredible transformation and the culture keeps getting better and better. Senior leadership is leading by example by embracing diversity, inclusion and belonging. We are working through how we can encourage people to speak up and share their perspectives. We have embraced volunteering and making a positive impact on our communities.
cons: We have a lot of work to do to strengthen the foundation and prepare for growth.

review_title: Good company, if you can handle verbal abuse from callers
job_title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) in Colville, WA
pros: Good company with good leadership
cons: Verbal abuse from callers was the most difficult part of this job.

job_title: Associate in San Francisco, CA
pros: Good people to work with. Immediate manager was a great mentor.
cons: Capped opportunity for growth internally. No promotion after several years of high performance

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oakland, CA
pros: When I started at Delta I expected good things, but I'm feeling very thankful to be part of such a positive, forward-focused team. Leaders genuinely walk the talk, and teammates across the enterprise are supportive and truly committed to re-imagining how to work smarter, not harder.  There always room to grow so I’m excited to do my part to move the needle.
cons: There are times that historical precedence keeps people from considering whether what they do is the right thing to do. So far though, most are willing to open the door to transformation eventually.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Alpharetta, GA
pros: I had a job for a month
cons: Pay wasn't great. They advised we would be hired after a few months. Once covid hit they let us go same day.

job_title: Cyber Security Professional in Oakland, CA
pros:
Delta Dental is the first organization I've worked at which truly honors its commitment to putting its employees and ethical values first. The CEO constantly talks about valuing employees, acting ethically, and contributing to society. And, more importantly, the organization puts it's money where its mouth it. They are constantly implementing new initiatives, programs, and benefits to show the employees how important they are, to benefit society, and to ensure the welfare of our customers and partners. They will do this even when doing so may seem detrimental to profits in the short run. But they have a long-term vision and a broader outlook which tells them that acting morally/responsibly will bring long-term success. 

* Works hard to take care of their employees and show employees they are wanted and appreciated. 
* Provides great benefits
* Makes you feel proud to work for them.
* Very transparent. CEO always explains actions clearly to the company so they understand why certain actions need to take place and how they benefit the organization and employees.
* Has a far-sight view (constantly looks ahead to prepare for potential challenges and ensuring they are ready for whatever the future and markets bring).
cons:
Management and ownership preach a lot about collaboration and positive interaction between departments, but I don't see much of it in practice. A lot of departments are very focused on their own work and productivity and view other departments as a hinderance. 

* Poor interaction between departments.

review_title: Great Company, need to update database systems
job_title: Credentialing Specialist in Cumming, GA
pros: Overall the company cares about it's employees, has incredible benefits, gives great yearly bonuses and gives back to the community.
cons: Upper, upper management needs to really get in touch with what the employees are doing. "The numbers show this and that" don't mean anything if they understand what their employees actually do. Companies across the nation do it as well.

review_title: Great team but not a lot of mobility
job_title: Finance Manager in Oakland, CA
pros: Great team, collabortive environment, trust leadership to do the right thing for employees
cons: Lack of mobility, crude processes, long hours during peak times

job_title: Operations Leadership in Alpharetta, GA
pros: Delta Dental is always seeking to develop you professionally within the organization but in turn wants you to bring ideas to the table in order to improve the organization itself. The company really takes care of its employees.
cons: There are items that are cons but the organization is already in the process of improving these areas such as work from home technology and data maintenance systems along with process improvement.

job_title: Claims Examiner in Alpharetta, GA
pros: Great benefits , annual bonus good schedule
cons: Salary low ,Not enough opportunity to excel

job_title: Senior Financial Analyst in San Francisco, CA
pros: I have been grow at Delta Dental by working on a wide-range of new projects and initiatives that has increased by overall skillset. Work-Life balance is very reasonable. Most importantly my co-workers are always respectful and encouraging.
cons: I feel sometimes we are behind in terms of the latest technology tools but over the past 3 years I think we have made huge strides to close that gap.

job_title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) in Mechanicsburg, PA
pros: pay is great,,, nice holidays off in your birthday month
cons: TRAINING on zoom was hard... have to pass final test with 85 or higher...IF not they let you work 2 days at the office then let you go

review_title: Rewards Creative Minds and Genuinely Takes Care of their People
job_title: Senior Business Intelligence Programmer/Analyst in Rancho Cordova, CA
pros: Very collaborative and supportive company culture. Professional without pretentiousness; the company sincerely cares for the careers, professional development, and overall health of their team members. Very welcoming.
cons: Dependence on legacy technologies is hard to overcome; very progressive leadership strives to advance new ideas, tools, and solutions but replacing legacy technologies is very challenging.

job_title: Grievance and Appeals Specialist in Rancho Cordova, CA
pros:
From day 1 I have felt welcome to the Delta Dental family. I feel very fortunate to have been placed on a challenging team. I learn something new every day, which is something I appreciate. 
The Delta Dental family truly wants you to do well with the company and I feel it every day. They are encouraging and very helpful should you ever have a question. You are not treated like just a faceless drone. You matter.
cons: Not a negative thing to say.

review_title: Great work life balance and culture

pros: Co-workers are awesome, great getting to work from home! Excellent benefits. Delta Dental really believes in helping there employees advance in there career it’s a very family orientated atmosphere!

review_title: A company that values its stakeholders (specifically, its people), is destined for success

job_title: Account Services Coordinator in Dallas, TX
pros: Great support from your team, very warm and inclusive company culture from the start, the company really cares about our customers, what we do, what we stand for as a company (our purpose), and about us as teams and individuals, growth opportunities, great compensation and benefits, opportunities to volunteer and give back to the community, lot's of ways for us to give kudos and encouragement to each other for a job well done...it's a great place to be!
cons: There's always room to improve systems and work practices to be more efficient, which I feel they actively work toward. I have no complaints!

review_title: This an opportunity to start a great career!
job_title: Customer Advocate in Alpharetta, GA
pros: I came back to Delta after a decade of other work and family planning. It was the experience that made me want to come back and begin my career with an organization that I trust and know is aligned with my professional and personal goals.. Great benefits, free dental and low cost health care. Bonuses quarterly, opportunities for advancement to any department with tuition reimbursement for acquired and related skills.
cons: Make the experience your own.

job_title: Account Sales Executive in Atlanta, GA

job_title: People Manager in Mechanicsburg, PA
pros: I love working at Delta Dental! I've been here for 4 years and each year it's gotten better. job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mechanicsburg, PA
pros: Delta Dental is unlike any place I've worked at previously. I am consistently inspired by our leaders and privileged to learn so much from my colleagues from all levels and departments.
